item.title: Do Federal Reserve Rate Cuts Cause Altcoin Seasons?
item.description: Historically, Federal Reserve rate cuts have tended to increase liquidity in financial markets, prompting investors to chase higher yields in riskier assets, such as cryptocurrencies. This capital flow has, at times, translated into large price spikes in Bitcoin, followed by corresponding spikes in many altcoins—a situation traditionally known as “altseason.”

item.title: PostgreSQL Vulnerability Exploited Alongside BeyondTrust Zero-Day in Targeted Attacks
item.description:
Threat actors who were behind the exploitation of a zero-day vulnerability in BeyondTrust Privileged Remote Access (PRA) and Remote Support (RS) products in December 2024 likely also exploited a previously unknown SQL injection flaw in PostgreSQL, according to findings from Rapid7.
The vulnerability, tracked as CVE-2025-1094 (CVSS score: 8.1), affects the PostgreSQL interactive tool psql.
